title: Kazeros The First After Race Update
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,There have been exciting moments on the battlefield in the race against Kazeros, along with dramatic moments off of the battlefield, but the time to open The First Mode to a wider group of players has arrived. We previously announced that after the top 10 teams in each region have been identified, the next weekly maintenance will unlock the First After Race, an ongoing mode where players can compete for class-based leaderboards based around clear time. Unfortunately, due to our version of Lost Ark having multiple regions, we cannot open the after race separately in the regions, it needs to be done at the same time.We’ve seen many requests from players who want to experience The First Mode, but want the damage increase that Ark Grid provides to help ease the difficulty slightly. While North America has the Top 10 locked in, there are still a few slots open in Europe. We will be giving the European region until the next maintenance to vie for the remaining leaderboard spots. The race will officially end, regardless of the number of eligible teams who have cleared, when weekly maintenance begins on December 24.During that maintenance, we will enable the First After Race, along with the ability for the Ark Grid system to be used in Kazeros The First. This will allow a wider range of players to attempt this special difficulty, and we’re also excited to see the beginning of the in-game leaderboards. Heroes at the top of leaderboard each week will earn temporary cosmetics, and those at the top when The First Mode ends (date to be determined) will earn the cosmetics (such as an insignia and class symbol) in perpetuity. The Ark Grid will become enabled for this mode.As a reminder, disqualifications are based solely on violations of the five conditions we set forth for the race as well as our Code of Conduct and Terms of Service, not player reports or leaderboard positioning. Our review process involves multiple independent team members examining account behavior, transaction patterns, and gameplay data. We do not discuss specific cases publicly, but all disqualifications are supported by clear evidence of policy violations.Congratulations to those who have participated in an eligible clear, and good luck players in the European Region this week! We have the cosmetic items ready for 1st - 6th place winners in North America, along with 1st - 5th place winners in Europe, and we will be distributing them this week. The rest of the custom rewards will be prepared in the coming weeks as we await the final week of clears in Europe, and will be distributed in early to mid January.Thanks for your support, and we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Winter's Wrath Release Notes
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,New solo challenges and a variety of progression updates arrive to help adventurers prepare for the battle at Diaspero against the Lord of the Abyss and his forces.Downtime will begin on December 17 at 12AM PT (8AM UTC) and is expected to last 8 hours. title: Kazeros First Clear Race Details
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,Kazeros The First is a special event where players can race to clear the most difficult version of Kazeros Raid Denouement: Final Day. Vanquishing Kazeros in this special version will pose quite a challenge, even for the best raiders in Lost Ark. But with extreme challenge comes prestige, and we have a variety of prestigious rewards planned for those who can vanquish Kazeros in his most powerful form. The race for Kazeros The First will begin on December 3 at 10AM PT (6PM UTC). Learn about the rewards, details regarding the competition, and the conditions needed to enter below.The First Mode General NotesTo enter, players much reach Item Level 1740 or higher and clear Act 4: Fortress of Destruction – Hard Difficulty (Gate 1 & 2). The First difficulty is treated separately from Normal/Hard in terms of entry count and rewards. Entry is limited to once per week per character. Rewards can be obtained once per roster during the entire event period.The Ark Grid effect is disabled during the Kazeros The First event. It will be re-enabled after the event ends. The First difficulty does not have revives. Extreme coordination and survival are required.LeaderboardsThe race to clear Kazeros The First will feature a leaderboard for the fastest groups to clear, with spots to celebrate the top 10 teams from each in-game region (North America and Europe). The leaderboards will first release alongside the The First Mode on December 3, and available for players to view throughout the race and beyond. These teams’ victory will stay showcased on the leaderboard, and each team will also earn a suite of in-game rewards. It may take some time for groups to be added to the leaderboard, as each group will need to be reviewed to ensure they meet the conditions. Please read the ‘Conditions’ section for the rules and conditions that parties must meet to be eligible for feature on the leaderboards.RewardsSimilar to the Kazeros Race Leaderboard, the in-game rewards will be rewarded on a per-region basis. This means that players in North America and Europe will each compete against the other players in their region for the following rewards contained within a Rank Box including:First Place in each region - Portal StatueSpecial Animated TitlesTop 1 – Kazeros The FirstTop 2 – Kazeros The SecondTop 3 – Kazeros The ThirdTop 4 - 10 – Kazeros Top 10Stronghold StructureWill have the players names etched into it along side their clear time. Users can see the information when interacting with the Stronghold Structure.Rank 1 - Unique 1st place StructureRank 2 & 3 - Structure unique to places 2 & 3Rank 4- 10 - Structure unique to places 4 - 10Adventure BannerRank 1 - UniqueRank 2 & 3 - Banner unique to places 2 & 3Rank 4 - 10 - Banner unique to places 4 - 10Please note that it will take several weeks to receive the top 10 rewards. However, upon clear and regardless of placement, all players who vanquish the special difficulty will receive a chest titled “Clear: Kazeros The First". It contains the following:Title "Lord of the Abyss"MVP Background: Final DayMount: Brilliant WingsLounge: Fortress of DestructionInsignia "Conqueror: Kazeros The First Difficulty"100,000 GoldConditionsCondition 1All participants must not engage in any actions that violate Amazon Game Studios’ policy (Amazon's Code of Conduct and Terms of Service), such as using illegal programs, exploiting bugs, RMT, Piloting, using apps that modify the game and/or interacts with it in a way that provides information that is otherwise not available to players, or engaging in any other actions that Amazon Games deems inappropriate. Players participating in the first clear race event will be investigated, and clears will not be official until uploaded onto the Leaderboard Website. Penalties for breaking the Code of Conduct or Terms of Service will range from disqualification up to a permanent ban.A player that has been previously penalized for RMT or other forms of cheating (such as using illegal programs, botting, exploiting bugs, piloting/account sharing, using apps that modify the game) in Lost Ark will be ineligible to compete in the first clear race, no matter when they received it (from launch until the race). Players with previous penalties (and their raid group) will still be able to complete the First Mode for the general rewards, but will not be eligible for leaderboard placement and Top 10 event rewards.Actions may be taken against offending players, and the entire party, such as invalidating the raid clear record, or removing achieved ranking records and event rewards. There are two exceptions to this policy:Players who were penalized for the Ignite Stronghold bug. Players who severely exploited this bug were perma-banned. Some other players received the rewards and opened without understanding that it was unintended, and for that reason we are allowing eligibility as long as there are no other disqualifying offenses logged or discovered in the account review.P...

contents: This month introduces one of our most anticipated releases yet — the climactic battle against Kazeros himself. Let's jump right in, starting with Paradise before going into the raids, new endgame activities, the Ark Grid System, and The First Race.Looking ahead, we'll reveal our plans for 2026 and beyond in December, and can't wait to share what's coming next. Until then, we hope you're preparing for Kazeros. Once these raids release, don't forget to share your victories with us on social media. title: Team Update - Progression Events
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,We’re making a few updates and changes to the plan surrounding progression events that were previously discussed in our last roadmap. Key, upcoming changes to improve player progression were recently shared through a Director Livestream in Korea, and we view these changes as extremely important to the player experience in the West. Some examples include improving the experience for Advanced Honing stages 1-2, removing Elixirs/Transcendence (and moving the effects elsewhere). These are changes that our team and community have been championing for, as they are important to the overall player experience in Lost Ark. We’re excited to collaborate with Smilegate RPG on bringing these changes to the West as soon as possible, and are delaying our planned progression events from November to December to accompany the release of as many of the changes as we’re able to.November will be about celebrating the endgame and the hardcore players eagerly awaiting their chance to challenge The Lord of the Abyss, and December will be focused on helping provide a better new and returning player experience. We have worked to extend the current Event Powerpass that was going to end in November for one month (until the December Update), as we didn’t want a month long gap while we wait for the changes. This should help any players who return or are looking to build out their roster in the meantime.November will include the Kazeros Challenge event, built to help players reach the endgame levels required to challenge Act 4 and Denouement: Final Day. This system will release as it did in Korea. Players will be able to complete endgame progression related missions, such as clearing raid gates and reaching item level thresholds, to earn valuable rewards that continue to help progression. It will help with systems such as Karma, Advanced Honing 3-4, and include a variety of honing, progression, and Ark Grid materials. We saw some concerns about needing to progress through both raids and maybe missing out on some Ark Grid materials or Gold week 1, so we’ve also added a little bonus event to give a few extra Ark Grid materials and 70K Gold for every player who completes some missions.However, we saw feedback that players wanted additional help, so you won’t have to wait long. Another event will release in December built to help increase progression (details are still being developed), alongside a new Powerpass and an Express event. Combined with our push to include progression updates, this should help all adventurers in Arkesia reach endgame, whether that’s a main character for a new or returning player, or existing players wanting to raise an alternate character.Mokoko Bootcamp will still return this month, and run until February with some changes. The Mokoko Bootcamp has been expanded to include players below Item Level 1700, Act 2 HM, Act 3 NM, and include a variety of new rewards. We anticipate Veteran players’ time to be more occupied at the beginning as they learn the two new endgame raids arriving; Act 4 and Denouement: Final Day, and will hopefully have more time to help Mokokos when the fresh wave of progression updates and events arrive in December. While there may not be as many Mokokos in November, players will still be able to help them through raids for event tokens if they have the time.While we know that some players were looking forward to creating a new character, we think that this update will be a large positive overall for players in different stages of their journey through Arkesia, letting Veterans challenge Kazeros before we welcome fresh waves of reinforcements in December. There will be more news of what you can expect in the November update in Eye on Arkesia later this week, and the full release notes next week.In the meantime, we wish you luck in your preparation for the Day of Prophecy, and we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Despite mass Amazon Games layoffs, its Lost Ark studio is "turning our eye toward the future" with plans into 2026
contents: The Lost Ark team reassures players that it's got plenty on the horizon moving into 2026 as publisher Amazon Games shuts down development on some of its other MMORPGs. Mass layoffs of approximately 14,000 jobs at the company have resulted in "significant role reductions" for its Irvine and San Diego studios, halting much of its first-party triple-A and MMO development, including the end of content updates for New World: Aeternum. That has naturally led to questions about Lost Ark's future. Read the rest of the story... title: Team Update - 10/28
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,We wanted to provide a quick update to confirm our plan ahead with the region merge, and touch on a few other topics that our team is still working on.Region Merge StatusIt’s been nearly a week since the region merge, and our team has loved witnessing the new relationships forming and increased opportunities for players to adventure throughout Arkesia together. We've been monitoring data, reviewing player feedback, and after many of hours of sleep post-merge, have been hopping in-game to test the new network structure ourselves. We're happy to see that it's been holding up well, and are excited to announce that we will be keeping this structure (so no need for the back-up plan we announced before the merge). The only update we plan to make is regarding Party-Finder and Matchmaking rulesets. In case you missed the first announcement, we have improved logic planned that will arrive in the November Update:Party-Finder: Instance will be created in the world of the lobby leader.Matchmaking:A full group of players from the original NA West worlds will have an instance created in NA West.A full group of players from the original NA East worlds will have an instance created in NA East.A mixed group of players will default to NA East. For players that rely on ping to NA West (such as those connecting from Oceania) we recommend using the party-finder tool to ensure they can find or create a lobby that best meets their needs.Tracking Future ProjectsWith the merge completed and the October Update featuring the Kazeros Prelude finalized, our team is now working to finish some upcoming plans. In the coming weeks, you can expect team updates on the following topics, and for players who missed some of our recent communications, here’s a few reminders.Kazeros ReleaseWe recently announced an updated plan and shared the dates for the release of Act 4, Kazeros, and the race to clear the First Mode. If you haven’t read through it, you can find it here: Team Update - Kazeros Release Plans.While the race was pushed back until December 3rd, we are working to finalize the race guidelines and plan to share them in the near future for the full details of what participants can expect from the competition.December Content Plans & 2026 RoadmapAfter locking in everything for Kazeros, we’ll be turning our eye toward the future of Arkesia, and preparing the roadmap for 2026 featuring Matt, Henry, and Roxx, which we plan to share in December. We’re working to finalize the content plan for the end of this year, along with the next chapter for adventurers. We’re extremely excited for the upcoming journey and for players to learn about what’s next.In the meantime, we wish you luck as you prepare for the war against Kazeros, starting with the Prelude available in the October update, followed by Act 4 and the Final Day raid against Kazeros himself— both arriving next month.

title: Community Emote Design Competition 2025
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,Craft an original emote for the chance to get your creation into Lost Ark. You can focus on your favorite character, create the perfect reaction for a preferred activity, or anything else— as long it is Lost Ark themed! Here’s everything you need to know to join the community emote design competition.Competition DetailsYou can enter your submissions to the emote contest through the official Lost Ark Discord by creating a post in the 2025 Emote Contest section of Discord (#2025-emote-contest-entries) with the image of your artwork attached. Submissions will be accepted from October 22 until November 12. Once we select 10 finalists, the Lost Ark community will vote on their favorites using reactions in Discord from November 14 through 19.The top 5 most popular emotes will get added to the game for everyone to use in a future update. Additionally, all ten finalists will receive the ‘Masterpiece Creator’ Title in-game, and the 10 finalist emotes will be available to use in the official Lost Ark Discord.Submission requirements include:A JPG or PNG under 25mbIdeal emote size is 500x500 at 300 DPI.Submission emotes need to be static images with transparent backgrounds unless there are intentional design decisions requiring a background color.Submissions must include character name and server name of the player submitting.Art must be original and cannot use AI.When preparing the winning emotes to be put in-game, some details may be removed or adjusted to better fit the game. Find the full contest rules here.If you’re unable to find the 2025 Emote Contest section of Discord, you can add the relevant channels to your list of viewable channels on the left side of your screen by navigating to “Channels & Roles” in the top left of the Discord UI, then navigating to “Browse Channels” and selecting the channels you would like to see.We’re excited to see what the community submits! Don’t forget to enter your emote submissions before the November 12 deadline, and check back on November 14 to vote on your favorite finalists.

title: Region Merge Update
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,The region merge for North America has arrived! The merge will begin tonight during the weekly maintenance at 12AM PT (7AM UTC). We are currently estimating total downtime for the North American regions to be 20hrs. For the European region, we estimate that downtime will last 8hrs.If you’re currently a resident of the North American regions being merged, learn about our plans for structuring servers, along with the planned compensation, gifts, and more!NA Server StructureOur teams at Amazon Games and Smilegate RPG have been collaborating in-person on some region merge magic to create the best possible experience for players post-merge. While the servers of North America West and East will be connected into one in-game region, the game worlds will remain in their original server locations. This will allow players to enjoy the positive aspects of the merge, such as a combined Auction House and Market, and new players to forge relationships within raid/dungeon groups, while mitigating concerns around latency/ping. Players will continue to enjoy the same experience while in their world, and you can learn more about the matchmaking/party-finder experience for instanced content below. For players joining from NA West, please note that the Auction House and Market will be hosted out of NA East, so players with high latency may notice slight lag in extreme circumstances.Dungeon/Raid ExperienceImmediately following the merge, we will be implementing a temporary ruleset for all instanced content (raids, dungeons, etc.). This temporary ruleset will be replaced with an improved version during the November Update, which will stay in-game as the planned final ruleset featuring different rules for matchmaking and party-finder.Temporary Ruleset (October - November) for matchmaking and party-finderInstances will default to NA East for lobbies with players from different worlds.If the lobby has 8 players from Brelshaza, the lobby will be created in Brelshaza.If the lobby has 8 players from Thaemine, the lobby will be created in Thaemine.However, if players from both Brelshaza and Thaemine are in a mixed lobby, they could still enter an instance hosted in NA East.Final Ruleset (Planned for the November Update)Party-Finder: Instance will be created in the world of the lobby leader.Matchmaking:A full group of players from the original NA West worlds will have an instance created in NA West.A full group of players from the original NA East worlds will have an instance created in NA East.A mixed group of players will default to NA East. For players that rely on ping to NA West (such as those connecting from Oceania) we recommend using the party-finder tool to ensure they can find or create a lobby that best meets their needs.We’re excited for the opportunities this will create for players to be able to play together while still having control and agency over their raid and dungeon experience, and will be on the lookout for feedback to ensure it is best meeting the needs of our community.Back-up PlanWhile testing has looked extremely promising for this custom solution leading up to the merge, we are preparing a back-up plan of hosting the Brelshaza and Thaemine Servers in NA East to avoid ongoing extensions of the region merge maintenance. If we need to proceed with the back-up plan, it could result in an additional maintenance. Afterward, we will continue to investigate the solution with NA West and NA East hosted servers that are connected, and identify a future window to make the change. We will provide updates and ensure the community is made aware of the status and result as we proceed through the merge.General Merge NotesWhile based in NA West, Brelshaza and Thaemine will need to share the same server time as the other worlds in the region, so they will be updated to NA East timing.It may take up to one hour for the NA West Crucible Leaderboard information to display after servers are up from the merge, due to the server refreshing rankings hourly.We’ll be on the lookout for feedback regarding the post-merge experience. If you encounter issues or have feedback, please let us know!After the MergeMerge CompensationThe following compensation gift will be available in the in-game shop \ for players in the merged region at no cost:Rest Bonus Recovery Brew x3Aura of Resonance Recovery Elixir (14 days) x3(NEW) Ebony Cube Entrance Ticket Selection Chest x3Regulus's Light Currency Chest x5Crystalline Aura (3 days) x1Collective Battle Item Chest x3There will also be a 1-day Azena’s Blessing compensation sent to each character in the merged region with Azena’s Blessing active during the merge. This compensation will be sent in the next week or two, once the data for the impacted characters has been collected. We appreciate your patience in the meantime!Merge Gift & Celebration PacksAlong with the merge compensation available for only players in North America, a gift will be sent to players in all regions, which can be...

title: Team Update - Kazeros Release Plans
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,In our previous team update, we discussed that we’d been reviewing lots of feedback around the Kazeros The First clear race along with the raid release plans. Today, we’re sharing an updated plan based around player feedback to ensure the release of the climactic battle against Kazeros is the best experience possible for the Lost Ark community.Updated Release PlanWe’ve been reviewing player feedback and collaborating heavily with Smilegate RPG to customize the release plan and find the solution that best meets the needs of the Western Playerbase. We investigated several release plans but ultimately decided on the raid rollout listed below. You can dive into the final version of the plan, including dates and commentary on our reasoning for selecting this release plan.Major November Update - November 19Kazeros Raid: Act 4 and Kazeros Raid Denouement: Final Day will be released together as part of the major November Update on November 19. We were initially hesitant to release both raids on the same day as it could be overwhelming for players, but when looking through various scenarios, we think this will best meet the needs of our diverse playerbase for the following reasons:For the top raiders, this will grant a practice window to level the playing field against players who have been practicing in other regions.For hardcore players, this will be a lot of content, especially when talking about multiple characters, but should prove to be an exciting update as players progress through one battle after another. If Hard or Normal mode for Denouement proves to be too much for the first week, there will be second week to clear before the first round of Frontier nerfs.For less hardcore players, where clearing as fast as possible is not a top priority and who enjoy the assistance of the Frontier System, this will allow a natural progression into the Frontier System in Denouement if the first few weeks after the update are spent learning Act 4. While normally we’d want to ensure that everyone is able to experience the original form of the fight before the Frontier system, Kazeros Raid Denouement will have a difficult version preserved for the foreseeable future with The First Mode allowing players to have a challenging experience on demand, even if they miss it in the first few weeks.Kazeros the First Race - December 3The First Mode (along with first clear race) will unlock two weeks later, on December 3, along with the first wave of Frontier Adjustments for both Kazeros Raid: Act 4 and Kazeros Raid Denouement: Final Day. We chose this date for 3 reasons:This will help level the playing field against players who have been practicing in other regions, by giving players two weeks to experience Hard Mode. While The First Mode will still present a greater challenge, this preparation time should help address a top concern amongst the broader community.We also saw concerns that the race would be taking place during North American holidays, which would prevent players from participating. This date will ensure players in North America are home and ready to play.The first wave of the Frontier Nerfs will allow players to reclear homework content faster than normal, for players who want to try their hand at The First Mode, without sacrificing the rewards from reclearing Act 4 and Denouement.In Game After Race Leaderboards – After Top 10The in-game After Race leaderboards will unlock during the weekly update after the leaderboard is full. This event will live in-game for the duration of the First Mode (until it ends at a future date, which is to be determined) allowing players to score their fastest clear time on character-based leaderboards and be rewarded with exclusive cosmetics and prizes!We hope this mode will prove fun for players who want to improve and prove they are skillful enough to master the battle against the Lord of the Abyss. While all players can participate in this secondary leaderboard event, our primary enforcement focus and restrictions remain centered around the First Clear Race for Kazeros, as the rewards for the After Race are on a rolling weekly grant. Seasonal Rewards are subject to additional reviews when the event ends at a date to be determined. Should an account on the After Race Leaderboard be found in new violation of our ToS, Code of Conduct, or event conditions, there may be action taken against the offending player, depending on the violation. This includes account-wide disadvantages, such as invalidating the clear’s eligibility, removing achieved ranking records and event rewards or an account ban.Looking AheadWe have seen a lot of player questions about the race and policies and will share the full policy document in the near future as we head toward the race. In the meantime, we hope the dates are helpful as you begin to determine your plans to meet the Lord of the Abyss in battle next month. title: October 2025 Region Merge Policy
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,On October 22, we will conduct a region merge to fold the NA West region into NA East. The NA West world names (Brelshaza & Thaemine) will remain the same and will be integrated into NA East. No servers (and therefore rosters) are being merged into each other. Policies that merge or sum item counts will only apply to players with an account in both server regions, and players within those regions can find the specifics below.Merge PolicyMarket, Auction House, and Currency ExchangeCancels all posted items and offers listed on the Item Market, Auction House and Currency Exchange in both Regions prior to the merge.Guild & Character NamesCharacters with duplicated character names will be reset based on following conditions:Retains the name of the character that belongs to a roster with a higher max character level.If condition A ties, retains the name of the first created character.Characters with reset names will be prompted to change their name when logging in.Overlapped guild names will be reset and receive a '##' in front of the original name based on following conditions:Retains the name of first created guild between two.If condition A ties, retains the target region data and resets the source region one.A Guild name change ticket for the guilds with force-changed names will be added as a token for guild masters.SocialFriend Info & Recent ListFriend list and friend requests will be retained and the list will reflect the character name changes due to duplicates.Names from the recent list will not be changed and stay as they were pre-merge.Progression events, Tickets, & TokensPowerpasses, Character Slot Extension title: October Team Update
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,As we head toward the North American Region Merge and the climactic battle against Kazeros arriving in November, we had a few quick topics we wanted to discuss. We’re going to dive right into a team update, and will also be following up with some more thorough updates and policies in the coming weeks.Region MergeNA West will be merged into NA East on October 22. The full policy will be released on October 15, but will be straightforward as no servers (and therefore rosters) are being merged. Because of the region merge, the October content update will be at the end of the month, arriving on October 29. We also wanted to give an early warning that after the October update, the time between the October and November updates will be shorter to adjust the update timing for November and December to the middle of the month.As previously shared, we’ve worked to create fairer naming policies for characters and guilds, and have been working to reduce the downtime by deleting permanently banned accounts to optimize our systems and improve the overall experience for legitimate players. While the downtime will still be extensive for NA West and NA East, we are working to ensure it is as short as possible.We are planning to release additional names from inactive accounts later this year or early next year, after the merge. We are conducting this after the merge to prevent players from potentially making multiple name changes only to lose their desired name alongside their original.RoadmapLucky BoxWe have seen speculation in the community surrounding the Lucky Box event, as different versions of this event have been released in different regions of Lost Ark around the globe. We wanted to clarify that the version releasing will closely resemble the version originally released in Korea, without the gacha-style systems present in other regions.For players not aware of what the system entails, you can complete daily and special missions to earn Lucky Boxes, which contain various honing materials, trade items, cards and potentially a Surprise Box. The Surprise Box has a chance to drop special items, like a Relic Engraving Selection Chest, Chaos Stones with a 100% success rate, Legendary Card Selection Pack, along with honing materials.Thaemine ExtremeAdditionally, we saw some questions asking if Thaemine Extreme would still be launching in the West. With the Assault Raid running until the first ever double raid release with Act 4 and Kazeros in November, the timing didn’t feel quite right. Along with the Ark Grid System we didn’t want to overwhelm players with too many raids and systems to learn, so we’re waiting to release it until the timing makes sense given other events and content releases. We’ll share more updates in the future, likely in a future roadmap.Kazeros The FirstOur team has been reviewing lots of feedback around the Kazeros The First clear race, raid release plans, and are doing our best to factor this into our plans and policies as we head toward the climactic battle in November. While these plans are still being developed, we wanted to share an early look at a few policies/plans.A player that has been penalized for RMT or other forms of cheating in Lost Ark will be ineligible to compete in the first clear race, no matter when they received it (from launch until the race). We will also be conducting extensive account reviews (similar to the Thaemine The First Race) to ensure there is no disqualifying behavior hidden in the past.While speed-hacking has not been a widespread issue in Lost Ark (in terms of volume), we understand the negative impact and we want to ensure that it won’t be present in the competition. While we generally don't post our ban or cheat detection numbers, we have been continuing to develop new detections methods for speed-hacks. Just in the past few weeks, we've caught and banned over 100 accounts using speed-hacks. This work will continue, and ramp up, as we head toward the race.We are continuing to investigate other plans for the release of Kazeros to ensure that it best fits our community, and will share any updates we have as soon as we’re able. We know that players who intend to race are curious about the date, and we’ll share that once the plan has been fully locked in.We appreciate the passion from the community along with the ongoing feedback and questions, and will be working to provide updates throughout the merge process and as we head toward the battle against Kazeros in November. In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Lost Ark 2025 Roadmap – Part 4
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,Welcome back to our final roadmap for 2025. We can’t wait for players to finally experience the epic conclusion to the Kazeros storyline, but there are even more major updates to look forward to between now and December, including the Ark Grid endgame progression system. Team members Roxx, Matt, and Henry also return for a glimpse into the next few months of Lost Ark in part 4 of our 2025 roadmap videos.Read on for a month by month summary featuring the highlights.OctoberRegion MergeThere will be a merge of the NA West and NA East regions one week before the major October Update. Stay tuned for announcements covering everything you need to know in the near future. We’ve factored in player feedback to ensure a more fair naming policy due to the large volume of idle names across each region. Our goal is to reward active players who created their name first based on the following policy:The name is granted to the player with highest combat level on their roster. For example, someone that has played since the launch of Tier 4 with a lvl. 70 character will receive the name over another player with roster with a lvl. 60 character from launch.If both names have the same highest level character on the roster (ie. both lvl. 70), the name will be granted to the player who first created the name. Guild names will be granted to whichever guild was created first.No servers or rosters will be merged. However, the downtime for the merged regions will be extensive. To help mitigate downtime, we are also working to remove the data of perma-banned bot accounts that have been banned for over a year. This will not impact players in good standing or with temporary bans.We have also been planning to release additional names from inactive accounts later this year or early next year, although it didn’t make sense to do so before this merge. We want to prevent players from potentially making multiple name changes only to lose their desired name alongside their original.Kazeros Raid Prelude: Destined TrajectoryThe corruption that began in the depths has crossed over the Kurzan Abyss, tainting the seas. The long-lost body of Kazeros has begun to take form within the fog. What will befall Arkesia in the future?Embark on a prologue questline that leads to truth as the long-prophesied war nears its end. A new NPC will be added to Elnead where you can start this quest. It can be completed once per roster, but only after finishing the Act 1 through 3 prologue quests as well as the Rimeria World Quest and Hyper Awakening Quests. The Kazeros Raid Prelude: Destined Trajectory will prepare you for the narrative climax against the Lord of the Abyss and is a requirement to enter the Act 4 Kazeros Raid.Additional UpdatesArk PassThe October Ark Pass will include the Mist Knight skins, cat mounts, and cat pets.Lucky Box eventComplete daily and special missions to earn Lucky Boxes and prepare for endgame challenges coming later this year. Lucky Boxes contain various honing materials, trade items, cards and potentially a Surprise Box. The Surprise Box has a chance to drop special items, like a Relic Engraving Selection Chest, Chaos Stones with a 100% success rate, Legendary Card Selection Pack, along with honing materials.Balance PatchThe Korean Balance patch that arrived alongside Kazeros will release in October!Proving Grounds Season 7This is the first Competitive Match season to feature the Three Champions Game Mode. Expect the standard competitive ratings adjustments based on performances in the last season, plus seasonal rewards when Season 7 wraps up next year. There will also be QoL adjustments, such as top ranked builds appearing in the Book of Coordination.NovemberKazeros Raid: Act 4Say hello to our first-ever double raid release, starting with Kazeros Raid: Act 4, the Fortress of Destruction. Act 4 is an 8-player, 2-gate, endgame raid starting with a memorable face-off against Covetous Master Echidna. As the battle goes on, her attacks grow increasingly varied. Higher up in the towering passages of Diaspero lurks the Abyss-infused statue sentinel, Armoche. Armoche dominates the battlefield with sweeping strikes from his halberd and shield.Normal Difficulty will require Item Level 1700 or above, and Hard Mode will require Item Level 1720 or above.Kazeros Raid Denouement - The Last DayVanquish the powerful enemies guarding the fortress to reach the battle that will determine the fate of Arkesia, an endgame 8-player, 2-gate raid. Even a brief misstep can result in instant death from Kazeros’ overwhelming attacks. He strikes across wide areas while simultaneously restricting movement, leaving little room to escape. Kazeros in Gate 1 is but a faint shadow compared to the despair that awaits. His true form will be revealed in Gate 2. Good luck! title: Team Update - Account Related Adjustments
contents: We’ve been working hard to prepare for the upcoming region merge and want to share an important policy update that will help ensure the smoothest possible experience for our active community members.Account Cleanup Policy - Banned Account RemovalAs we approach the NA West and NA East merge this October, we’re implementing a comprehensive cleanup of permanently banned accounts to optimize our systems and improve the overall experience for legitimate players. Starting this week, we will begin removing accounts that meet specific criteria related to violations and ban duration.Which Accounts Are Being Affected:Accounts with bot-related permanent EAC (Easy Anti-Cheat) bans that have been in place for over 365 daysAccounts with permanent bot-related penalties that have been in place for over 365 daysOnly accounts with permanent bot related violations - temporary bans and active accounts are not affectedTimeline and Maintenance ImpactThis account removal process will begin this week and continue leading up to the region merge. Players should be aware that some of our scheduled maintenances may run longer than usual as we work through this cleanup process. We’re breaking it up to avoid one extremely long downtime, especially as we keep the downtime for Region Merge in mind. We will provide updates on extended maintenance windows as they occur.Why We’re Making This ChangeWe’re implementing this policy for several key reasons that will benefit our active community:Database Optimization: By reducing the volume of permanently banned account data, we’re streamlining what needs to be migrated during the region merge, which will help ensure a smoother transition process.Performance: We want to maintain highest standards for account security and system performance.Transparency and Moving ForwardWe remain committed being as transparent with our player base as possible and felt this behind the scenes change warranted a Team Update so that players know what our team is working on and what to expect with the varied downtimes leading up to the merge. And remember, this this cleanup exclusively targets accounts that have been permanently banned for serious violations, and have been in a banned state for an extended period of time. Active players and those with temporary penalties will see no impact from this process.As we continue preparing for the region merge and other exciting updates coming through the end of the year, we're committed to ensuring that Arkesia remains the best possible experience for our dedicated community. We appreciate your understanding as we work to optimize our systems, and we'll continue to provide updates on our progress. We will also continue to share key information for players the North American regions as we head toward the merge.We'll see you in Arkesia!

title: Behind the Scenes: Valkyrie Class
contents: We caught up with Smilegate RPG for more insight into the Valkyrie class before she slashes through Arkesia on August 20.The Valkyrie class is easy to pick up, but flexible in how players can showcase their skill. This flexibility extends to its ability to switch between damage dealer and support. From skills and combat animations to skins and class design, Valkyrie faithfully delivers the essence of a holy warrior, making her highly appealing to those who value immersive character visuals.Q: The Valkyrie brings a fresh take on the holy warrior archetype to Lost Ark. What makes Valkyrie stand out from other classes as well as her male Paladin counterpart?A: Like the Paladin, Valkyrie uses a one-handed sword and channels her Faith Gauge as a resource. However, her combat design and playstyle introduce distinct differences. The most notable difference lies in her identity system. While the Paladin sustains allies through continuous healing and damage reduction via divine aura, Valkyrie utilizes two identity skills—Release Light (Z) and Light of the Faithful (X)—to offer situational support like offensive buffs or instant recovery.Another key distinction is her damage-dealing role through the Ark Passive. The Paladin focuses on steady back-attack-based damage, whereas Valkyrie delivers explosive bursts centered around the skill Final Splendor (X). Even though they share the same resource, the flow and feel of battle differ dramatically.In terms of combat tempo and feel, Valkyrie offers a faster, flashier, and more agile experience than the heavier, grounded playstyle of the Paladin.Q: Her armor and weapon designs are very distinct. What were the inspirations behind her launch skin visual design?A: We began the costume design with a focus on conveying the “sanctity” shared by the Paladin and their gender-locked counterpart, the Valkyrie. To express the clean and pure image that sanctity evokes, we drew inspiration from a bride in a white dress walking down the aisle. The off-shoulder design was also influenced by this concept. We chose white and gold, colors commonly used in bridal rings, as the main palette.The halo, which shines like the glow of the head avatar, further enhances the sense of sacredness. Additionally, to emphasize the keyword “Holy Warrior,” we incorporated armor elements into the costume. However, we avoided overly flashy or extravagant designs that wouldn’t suit a holy warrior, and instead based the design on traditional medieval armor.Q: The Valkyrie's weapon design, alongside her ability to wield two swords, is quite striking. Can you share why the team opted for two swords instead of a sword and shield?A: From early development, a key goal was to differentiate Valkyrie's combat actions from those of the Paladin. While the Paladin projects a calm, defensive presence through his use of a one-handed sword and holy book, Valkyrie was designed to deliver a more aggressive and dynamic feel.To achieve this, Valkyrie was conceptualized to wield multiple sacred relic weapons, depending on the situation. One example is her skill that has her summon and wield a sacred sword alongside her normal sword and briefly engage in dual-blade combat. This symbolizes both her divine power and offensive potential.Weapons like the sacred shield, spear (used in Hyper Awakening), and sacred banner (used in Hyper Awakening) are featured throughout her skill set. These diverse weapon types create a more immersive and cinematic experience, breaking away from the monotony of single-weapon classes. The visual design of divine energy channeling through her sword also reinforces her core concept.Q: What makes Valkyrie visually and functionally different in battle, especially as a support?A: Valkyrie's skills are divided into three categories: Justice, Starlight, and Protection. Each has a distinct theme and purpose.Justice Skills focus on minimal use of divine power, instead relying on refined swordsmanship to present a disciplined and knightly image. Motions like striking and holding posture emphasize composure and control.Starlight Skills allow Valkyrie to summon a sacred sword in her left hand, wielding it like a dual blade, or infusing her one-handed sword with divine energy for powerful strikes. This category enhances her identity as a valiant and symbolic holy warrior.Protection Skills use sacred shields to protect allies or weaken enemies. Some skills include impact animations to strengthen her presence as a defensive class.Unlike traditional ranged supports that provide stable backing from a distance, Valkyrie is designed to engage more actively in battle. Her hybrid structure shares some skills with the DPS Ark Passive, featuring many aggressive visuals. She dashes toward allies and supports them from close range, offering a more hands-on, proactive support experience compared to other support classes.Q: Let's talk about sound. title: Team Update - August 2025
contents: We wanted to share some key information leading up to the August “Rise of the Valkyrie” Update, as we’ve locked in some policies and key changes we know you’ve been looking forward to! It’s been a fun few weeks watching players learn the new Paradise system, progress through the Mokoko Challenge Express, and help new and returning players learn the ropes. The August Update, featuring the Valkyrie Class, will also include a ton of other impactful updates. As always, some things may shift during ongoing development— make sure to checkout next week’s release notes for the final August details.Major August Update - Rise of the ValkyrieBonus PowerpassIn the August Update, we will also be granting all players an additional South Kurzan Powerpass! We saw an enormous amount of new and returning players begin or resume their adventures in Arkesia with the July Update, and want to provide a little boost to help them build out their roster or try out new classes/playstyles. No worries if you haven’t used the first one yet, they will stack.Rise of the Valkyrie EventHeading toward the update, we wanted to share some topline information to help players best plan out how they plan to use the latest “road/path” style event. It can be paired with the Mokoko Challenge Express, or activated on another character. Key details:Event Target Item Level: 1640 – below 1681 can start the event.Honing Support Effects will be provided from Item Level 1660 to 1680.Item Level Rewards will be provided for 1640, 1650, 1660, 1670 and 1680.Players can earn the Item Level 1680 complete rewards and the chest will contain the 1690 and 1700 Rewards chests.Challenge missions will include clearing Aegir and Brelshaza.Rewards will include an assortment of Honing Materials and other Progression Materials. One notable reward will be four bound Tier 4 Lv. 7 Gems!Ebony Cube Update PolicyAs previously shared, In the August Update, we’re going to make a change to Ebony cube and how it interacts with Paradise. This change will double the rewards provided by Ebony Cube, but reduce the Cube Ticket drop rate by 50% (in all places, including the guild shop and dispatches). We think this change will make Ebony Cube more exciting to play, and will also help decrease the amount of homework content with the addition of Paradise. As some players have massive stockpiles of tickets, and others have been dutifully running cubes whenever they get a ticket, 2 tickets will combine into one ticket (with the new doubled rewards) when the update takes place to maintain a fair balance for all players. This will work in the following ways:Players with Cube tickets in their inventories will have the tickets automatically converted.Cube Selection Chests (across the roster in various storages) will be converted as well.The full policy will be shared in the release notes. Please note that the cube changes only apply to Tier 4.Additionally, we will also be adding the ability to convert Ebony Cube Tickets into Hell Keys through the Paradise Exchange Vendor. Each exchange can be done on each character once a week, due to large stacks of cube tickets that currently exist in the wild that would disproportionally favor some players.T4 (1640) Rare Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 1st Unlock x2T4 (1640) Epic Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 1st Unlock x3T4 (1640) Legendary Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 1st Unlock x5T4 (1680) Rare Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 2nd Unlock x2T4 (1680) Epic Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 2nd Unlock x3T4 (1680) Legendary Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 2nd Unlock x5T4 (1680) Epic Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 3rd Unlock x2T4 (1680) Legendary Hell Key x1Cost - Ebony Cube 3rd Unlock x4Tier 3 UpdateTo ensure that players in Tier 3 can be competitive in the weekly Crucible rankings, and for new players/returning players building characters and learning new playstyles, we’re going to move the Hyper Awakening and Hyper Awakening Skills (T-Skills) to unlock in Tier 3. Full details of how this will be unlocked in Tier 3 will be available in next week’s release notes!With the Valkyrie Advanced Class, new skins, further support class balance changes and much more— the August Update will include a ton of content and impactful changes for all. The full release notes will be available before the update next week! In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Team Update - Awaiting Paradise
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,Next week’s release notes are shaping up to be the longest set of notes on record. Before those drop, we had a few topics we wanted to discuss in a setting outside of the release notes.Event ReminderBefore we dive in, here’s a quick reminder from our previous Team Update. With the player-requested change to have the progression events release in July alongside the Paradise Update, players interested in making the Valkyrie Advanced Class will need to wait to activate the progression events. The events will still be live for several months after the release of the class— plenty of time to progress and unlock all the benefits offered by the Mokoko Challenge Express.To coincide with the Summer Player Gift, we will also be sending the Legendary Skin gift to all players with the July update! Players who want to use the Legendary Skin on the Valkyrie Advanced Class will be able to hold it until the class releases. Once again, we think this will be a net benefit for all players. The timing won’t change for Valkyrie enthusiasts, but sometimes patience can be more difficult when the shiny skins are sitting in your inventory. We wish you luck!Mokoko BootcampMokoko Bootcamp will be releasing with a variety of changes built to help players organically progress and learn, and will be running until October. We hope to continually improve the system, and will be on the lookout for additional feedback to ensure that this community-centric event is accomplishing the goals of breaking down gate-keeping barriers and making helping others a fun time for all. To fit that theme, the title for this version of the Mokoko Bootcamp will be “Mokoko Gatesmasher”, accompanied with a title icon of a hammer.As these events are built to promote community cohesion, we thought it may be fun to get the community more involved in the title and icon process heading forward. For future Mokoko Bootcamps, we’re going to run a title and icon contest to put the power in the hands of the community to decide what you want. We didn’t want every title to follow the same bootcamp theme and lose their value, so we thought this could be a fun way for veteran players to choose their reward. We’ll follow up with more details (and contest rules) as we head toward the next Bootcamp, but wanted to share our idea so people could begin brainstorming alongside any other feedback they have on the event!Gold AdjustmentsWith Paradise introducing vast new quantities of progression materials (including fusion materials and character bound gold), and the progression event providing everything a new player could need (from max cards to entry level accessories), we are introducing some gold changes for endgame content to better balance rewards.Our goal with the changes was to prevent alternate rosters from farming too much gold that could be moved to other rosters/accounts, while ensuring that players in those levels weren’t impacted heavily. Some solo modes have had their gold increased, some other raids will see decreases, and a few just have changes to the balance of bound gold vs. unbound gold. For example, the highest level raid adjusted was Aegir (Normal), with no changes in total gold, but with a rebalance to move some gold into bound gold. Additionally, the bonus item boxes (view more rewards) that can be purchased after each gate have been decreased in price for many raids (up to Aegir Hard Mode) to reward players who are looking to continue to progress their characters.We wanted to share this update ahead of time, and explain the reasons in a place outside of the release notes— since they’re over 23,000 words total! There’s a lot of other things that will be covered in those notes early next week, including the full number changes for raids with changed reward prices and changed total gold amounts.Bonus note— to help players who want to work on their roster as a whole, we have pivoted the character bound gold in the Mokoko Challenge Express event to be roster bound gold.Market DiscussionsBound GemsAs previously announced, the July update will introduce the Luminous Gem system into the Western version of Lost Ark. Our region’s player to player market was more resilient than other regions, and the price of level 10 damage gems today have barely decreased from their price when the original announcement was shared in Korea. As level 10 damage gems have retained nearly all of their value and they will still be fully usable by their owners, the compensation sent out in some other regions of Lost Ark will not be distributed in the Western version.We’re excited for the new and fun customization opportunities that the Luminous Gem system will provide for all players, with greater freedom to try out new builds, and that the new T4 Luminous Gems in the Solo Shop help new and returning players gear up for the challenges that await them in the war against Kazeros.Sidereal EnergySimilarly, our region didn’t experience major price fluctuations for Sidereal En...

title: Team Update - July 2025
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,We've shared several exciting announcements through LOA ON and our recent Roadmap Part 3 article. While we've worked to provide comprehensive details in our updates, there are additional topics the community has been discussing that we'd like to address and offer more clarity.Style Book and Stronghold Portrait PolicyFirst off, we’ve seen some confusion in the community regarding moderation of style book and portrait uploads. Anything that is merely showing off an in-game character in their skins/cosmetics is allowed (including swimwear and other revealing outfits). However, we will be moderating and applying penalties for uploads that attempt to depict sexual acts, character nudity with skin dyes, and other disruptive or harmful content. You can refer to the Amazon Games Code of Conduct for further information on what type of content is not tolerated.July UpdateAlong with everything we already announced for July (Paradise, May/June Balance, UI improvements, Solo Aegir & Solo Rework, Skin Book, Una Overhaul, Gem Updates, Party Finder Lounge, Tripod Level/Epic Engraving simplification), there is a ton more in the update. When we share some of those specifics early in the roadmap, it’s meant to be an early sneak-peek into what’s coming, but not a comprehensive list of everything. There is a ton more arriving in July, so here’s a few more selected spoilers (which we’ve seen the community asking about) to keep up the excitement before the full release notes with every detail are shared:Maharaka Festival will be returning.You will be able to celebrate in the pools of Maharaka Paradise with the latest swimsuit skins!The Achievement system overhaul is arriving.4 Hairstyles will be added (2 for each base class).Beginner Growth Improvements:Guide mission adjustments.Mokoko Buff Extended to 1660.Procyon's Protection expanded up to Aegir.Gear Crafting requirement reduction.Additional QoL surrounding daily activities, including Kurzan Frontline, Guardians, and Una’s Tasks.Progression Event UpdateWe saw a lot of player requests for our team to attempt to move the Valkyrie Advanced Class from August to July. While the class won’t be ready in time, we also saw a lot of requests bubbling up in the community to have the progression events active for players returning or interested in starting their adventure in Arkesia when the massive amount of improvements arrive— so we made the decision to release the Powerpass and Mokoko Challenge Express Event early, in the July Update.This shift means that players interested in making the Valkyrie Advanced Class will need to wait to activate the events, but we think that giving new or returning players the ability to hop right into the action will be a better experience overall. For those who wanted to create a Valkyrie nothing will change, and the events will still be live for several months after the release of the class— plenty of time to progress and unlock all the benefits offered by the Mokoko Challenge Express. We will provide a few more additional notices reminding players to save the events for Valkyrie if they’re planning to use them when the class releases in August.We are planning to have an additional event that will release in August, similar to past “road/path” events to further help players progress, or allow players planning on making the Valkyrie Advanced Class to quickly progress.Long Term ProjectsWe are currently targeting this fall (around October) to merge NA West & NA East, so we will have one region for North America and one for Europe. We’ve seen a lot of player feedback both requesting this merge along with questions regarding when it may happen, so we wanted to provide an update. There’s a ton of details that we’ll dive into as we head toward the merge in future team updates along with dedicated policies about the merge, but we wanted to be transparent about when we anticipate this arriving.This will be a major project requiring a lot of the team’s attention, so we will need to put some other projects on the backburner, including work on the API. We will provide future updates on the API when we’re able, but need to adjust internal resources in the meantime.Looking AheadWhile we provided some additional spoilers in this team update, there are still many other changes arriving to make your experience in Arkesia even better in the July Update. We’re excited to see players progress faster with Paradise and major QoL adjustments, and will be on the lookout for feedback as we continually strive to make life in Arkesia the best it can be.We appreciate the ongoing support, feedback, and passion from you, the Lost Ark community, and will continue to provide team updates as soon as we’re able. In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia!

title: Mythic Desert Collection Store Showcase
contents: Go behind the scenes with Smilegate RPG on the western exclusive Mythic Desert collection. This latest store showcase introduces the Onyx Mythic Desert skins, Quartz Mythic Desert skins, Mystic Chameleon pet, and the Kingstrider mount. How will you stand apart as a sovereign of sand across all of Arkesia?Check out the full selection throughout our interview below, plus the stunning desert temple Chrome Sanctuary wallpaper. From concept to creation, here’s how the Development Team crafted each cosmetic. Q. What inspired the overall theme and aesthetic of this cosmetic set?A: The Mythic Desert cosmetics were inspired by the transcendent and ornate depictions of gods and priests found in ancient desert murals. From there, we explored ways to reinterpret the grandeur and mystique of ancient priesthood within the fantasy world of Lost Ark.The defining features of this skin set are its symbolic patterns and visual effects. For the patterns, we drew from hieroglyphs and motifs seen in ancient desert artifacts, infusing them with our game's unique aesthetic.As for the accessories and effects, we focused on capturing the shimmering golden hues of desert sands under the sun. The silhouettes reminiscent of halos and wings further emphasize the divine nature of the design.Q. Were there any changes made during implementation compared to the original concept art? What challenges did you face in bringing the design in-game?A: One of the main challenges was preserving the unique feel of the emissive patterns and effects portrayed in the concept art. It was crucial for us to bring those visuals to life in-game with minimal loss in quality.This required close and seamless collaboration between the concept, modeling, and effects teams, with constant communication and testing throughout the process.As a result, we were able to not only retain the beauty of the original concept but elevate its presence in-game. We believe the final product turned out to be a truly eye-catching piece.Q. What inspired the designs for the Mystic Chameleon pet and Kingstrider mount?A: The pet was inspired by desert chameleons—creatures that embody resilience in harsh environments. We reinterpreted their adaptability with a playful and whimsical twist.Reflecting the chameleon's ability to change its color depending on the environment, we created a range of diverse and unconventional color variations.For the mount, we took inspiration from the griffin, a mythical creature revered in ancient mythology. Griffins—part lion, part eagle—symbolize both strength and divine authority.To capture the image of a powerful keeper, we designed the mount with sturdy armor, while still aiming for a sleek and agile appearance to suit its flying movement.Q. Since this is global-exclusive content, did you take into account any aesthetic preferences unique to that region?A: Yes, we definitely considered the preferences of global players, especially their appreciation for clear visual direction.We incorporated strong visual contrast, bold effects, and iconic symbols of ancient desert civilizations to align with those tastes.Additionally, we recognized that global users often value cohesive design and narrative depth, so we designed the costume, weapon, pet, and mount to share a unified backstory and symbolism. By doing so, each component contributes to a more immersive and cohesive worldbuilding experience through the cosmetic set.Q. How was designing a wallpaper like Chrome Sanctuary, which diverges from the existing in-game concepts, different from creating standard in-game environments?A: Unlike traditional concept art, which is usually grounded in the main storyline, the wallpaper for the global region allowed for much more creative freedom.From the initial planning phase, the concept was shaped around the tastes of global users, and that direction made the process both refreshing and engaging.In-game environment concepts typically need to align with existing worldbuilding frameworks, which can limit creative flexibility. However, in this case, the ancient desert inspired fantasy theme was entirely new to us—giving us more room to experiment and explore freely.It was a fun and memorable experience, and we’d love to continue working on more content that caters to global tastes in the future.The Mythic Desert collection is available now in-game. Visit the in-game store \ to find your next outfit.Thanks for your support! We’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Lost Ark 2025 Roadmap – Part 3
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,Lost Ark team members Roxx, Matt, and Henry are back with the next installment of the Lost Ark roadmap, covering what’s in store for July, August, and September, along with a sneak peek at some of the major updates arriving before the end of 2025. As always, since Lost Ark is a live-service game, plans may shift, but we’re excited to reveal what’s ahead—let’s dive into the upcoming content and systems arriving in the second half of the year. Watch the Roadmap video update for the full discussion and deep dive, or find an express summary below the video.JulyNew Progression System: ParadiseLaunching late July, Paradise is a new seasonal system designed specifically for the global version of Lost Ark to help speed up progression and give players new experimental, solo content. Paradise helps players earn valuable rewards through three interconnected activities:ElysianFight waves of monsters to collect Legacy of Paradise gear—a new set of upgradeable equipment (e.g. belt, cloak) that only applies within Paradise. Gear is tiered and can be upgraded through:Restoration – which boosts base statsResonance – adds bonus effects once restoration thresholds are metHigher Paradise levels will unlock throughout the season, and all gear resets between seasons.CrucibleTake on bosses in a 1v1 battle with nearly all power coming from your Legacy of Paradise gear—making this content accessible for all classes, including supports. Since the recording of the roadmap video, we made the decision to simplify the name from “God’s Testimony” to Crucible, better matching the other one word activity names.Includes valuable first-time clear rewards, along with weekly class-based leaderboards reward players with Hell Keys. Every player who participates will receive some keys, with players who place higher receiving higher grade and more keys.Earn and equip the Orb, a special gear piece that carries power outside of Paradise and scales based on your peak seasonal progression.HellUse your Hell Keys to descend through a 100-floor dungeon, earning better rewards the deeper you go.Clearing floors will be easy, like a chaos dungeon. It’s more about trying to hit some lucky effects and descend as far as possible.Loot includes gold, upgrade materials, Paradise gear, and the rewards are selectable at the end to give players a choice of what they need most between the available options.Solo Mode & Mokoko BootcampSolo Aegir joins the roster with an updated Tier 4 reward shopSolo Raid difficulty adjusted to be easier for new playersMokoko Bootcamp returns with:Aegir (Act 1) Hard ModeBrelshaza (Act 2) Normal ModeItem level cap set at 1689 to ensure players can naturally progress without losing their statusQuality of Life & System UpdatesSkin Book System: Manage, preview, and craft all skins in a new streamlined interface.Una’s Task Overhaul: Dailies transition to weekly rewards after reputation completion, reducing daily grindBalance Patch: Korean May & June class updates includedTripod & Epic Engraving Removal to simplify character systemsBound Gem Improvements: Swap damage/CD types more freelyUI Updates:Improved character profileAccessory highlighting by refinement levelNew Party Finder LoungeAugustNew Advanced Class: ValkyrieThe long-awaited female Paladin, named Valkyrie, arrives in August!Choose between:Support Build: Protect allies with divine shieldsDPS Build: Summon holy swords to smite enemiesReleased alongside several progression events and a legendary class giftPrestige Shop LaunchEarn Prestige Points equal to 10% of Royal Crystals spent in the in-game shopRedeem for cosmetics like exclusive skins, MVP backgrounds, and moreRetroactive tracking included—no lost points!SeptemberLimited-Time Raid Event: Assault – RimeriaThe frozen continent of Rimeria faces a new threat: Abyssal Beasts have emerged, and it’s up to you to stop them. This limited-time event includes two types of content:1–4 Player Event Dungeon - Abyssal Wrath, NarhashDifficulty scales with party sizeWeekly clear per characterRewards: Event Medals (spend in a special shop)Item Level: Normal (1660+), Hard (1700+)8-Player Raid – Flame of Darkness TarkalOne-gate boss fightItem Level: Normal (1680+), Hard (1720+)Weekly Tier 4 Endgame entryRewards:Ancient-grade accessoriesHoning materials, Destiny StonesDawn Defender’s Chest - Gold reward chest (up to 500K in Hard Mode)First time clear rewardsHard mode: no Epic loot (minimum gold: 38,000), Random Relic Engraving ChestsQ4 2025Kazeros RaidBattle the Lord of the Abyss in an epic endgame raidSet to be one of the most ambitious fights in Lost Ark historyFinal ThoughtsWith Paradise, Valkyrie, and Rimeria: Assault on the horizon—and Kazeros still to come—the second half of 2025 is shaping up to be one of the biggest chapters in the history of Arkesia. title: Team Update - Summer LOA ON & Roadmap News
contents: Heroes of Arkesia,This weekend, Smilegate RPG showed off the major updates, content, and future for Lost Ark. We’re excited to discuss the future of Lost Ark in the west, and are in the process of finalizing our next roadmap video. Join Lost Ark team members Roxx, Henry, and Matt for Part 3 of the 2025 Roadmap on July 1, with a full deep dive into all the content arriving in July, August, and September. It will also provide further discussions about other major pieces of content arriving throughout the rest of 2025— featuring some of the biggest news in LOA ON along with Western exclusive news. While the full video won’t be ready until July 1, we know the community wants to know when some critical pieces of content are arriving, so to hold you over until the video, here’s some topline spoilers for the next few months!2025 Roadmap - Part 3 TeaserJulySummer Update GiftFirst off, we know the community is always excited about the LOA ON gift sent to players. The LOA ON gift will be granted to all players in the Western version of Lost Ark in July, as a summer gift celebrating the launch of Paradise, a system designed to help increase progression and add more casual solo activities for the global audience.New Progression System: ParadiseLaunching in July, Paradise is a new seasonal solo progression system designed specifically for the global version of Lost Ark. Paradise helps players earn valuable rewards through three interconnected activities.Solo Mode & Mokoko BootcampSolo Aegir joins the roster with an updated Tier 4 reward shopMokoko Bootcamp returns with:Aegir (Act 1) Hard ModeBrelshaza (Act 2) Normal ModeQuality of Life & System UpdatesSkin Book System: Manage, preview, and craft all skins in a new streamlined interface—with the power increase system removed.Una’s Task Overhaul: Dailies transition to weekly rewards after reputation completion, reducing daily grindBalance PatchTripod & Epic Engraving Removal to simplify character systemsAnd many more QoL adjustments!AugustThe long-awaited female Paladin arrives in August! You’ll have to tune into the roadmap for the western name reveal. It will be accompanied by progression events to help new and existing players alike level up quickly. The Prestige Shop will also launch for players to exchange prestige points for some exciting new items.SeptemberThe continent of Rimeria faces a new threat, as Abyssal Beasts have emerged. It’s up to you to stop them. For players familiar with this content in Korea, players often referred to it as the ‘Strike Raid’. The limited time event will be called Assault: Rimeria, in the West. This limited-time event includes two new playable activities:1–4 Player Event Dungeon8-Player Endgame Event RaidWe hope this tease was enough to hold you over until July 1. Join us then for the full roadmap diving further into each of these months, and some major moments arriving throughout the rest of the year. In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Team Update - June 2025
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/35SzHNct6fghTK0PS3RvQu/6bb37039954b546deeadea234687d9f2/LA_Blog_SS_09_1920.jpg Heroes of Arkesia, We wanted to provide an update on topics we discussed throughout our recent team video and some found within the latest Korean livestream. We will also be attempting to provide some clarity on other items we haven’t talked about yet. Three quick reminders before we dive in: If you haven’t watched the latest Team Update where Roxx, Matt, and Henry cover some major upcoming changes in the West you can find it here. It has a lot of context you’ll otherwise be missing! As this is a follow-up to that video, we will provide the context necessary for some items, but not at the same depth. We are striving to be as transparent as possible, but don’t want to share dates that could fluctuate this early in the process. To avoid disappointments, we will be sharing general timeframes in this article for the discussed items arriving after the June Update. The next roadmap will be releasing in early July, so if you’re wondering when some of these features will be releasing, make sure to tune in! Similar to the note above, many of these items are in active development, so you may see some changes throughout the process of bringing them to the West. We will share any major updates or changes with you as soon as we can. June Update As June was on the previous roadmap, we wanted to share a few adjustments that will be included soon! Raid Balance & Resurrection System for Kazeros Raids With the June monthly update arriving several weeks after the Act 3 raid, we will be implementing a resurrection system and decreasing the difficulty of several past raids (Behemoth, Echidna, Aegir, and Brelshaza). The June release notes will have full detailed descriptions for both the raid balance adjustments along with the resurrection system, but the quick summary is that each player will receive a single revive (per gate attempt), that can be used after dying to most things (excluding certain patterns or wipe mechanics). This will allow the first few weeks of the Frontier System to remain challenging for Act 3, but will ensure that all raids become more accessible for casual players and alternate characters. Stylebook & Stronghold Portrait Systems We’re excited to announce that the Stylebook feature will be arriving in the main June update at the end of the month. We’ll provide a full overview in the June release notes, but a quick summary of the Stylebook is that it’s a tool that allows players to upload screenshots of their outfits and style for other players to use as inspiration. Players can upvote various looks and favorite them to influence their own styles. We’re very interested to see who will emerge as style icons in the West. Along with the Stylebook feature, new screenshot tools will become available, including a frame feature in the Stronghold where players can display their favorite screenshots. Summer 2025 Mokoko Bootcamp While we saw a lot of positive feedback reinforcing the decision to tie Mokoko status to 10x Raid Clears, we also saw some player concerns about the system still having an Item Level cap after we shared the planned changes, so we wanted to share the planned level. When the Mokoko Bootcamp returns this summer with the adjustments, it will be extended to include Aegir (Act 1) Hardmode and Brelshaza (Act 2) Normal Mode. For these raids, we plan for the Item Level cap to be at 1689, so that players aren’t punished for continuing to progress after reaching the respective Item Levels for those raids at 1680 and 1670. We will continue to lookout for feedback on the system, and appreciate the feedback we’ve received so far! Skin Collection Book Quick context; it’s a feature that allows for a more organized cosmetic collection and expands the number of available slots to stash cosmetics in your inventory. This will release alongside the Paradise system this summer, without the power increase and ranking systems found within other versions of Lost Ark. We hope this is a helpful tool for expanding the closets of Arkesian fashionistas, but don’t want there to be additional pressure to collect every skin. Una’s Task Improvements In the last player survey, we had specific questions about your thoughts on dailies. The feedback provided by you, the Lost Ark Community, helped us during discussions about changes for the Western version of the game. As a direct result, we are very excited to bring the following change to the West. Daily Una’s Tasks will be improved to help balance the amount of daily/weekly ‘homework’ activity when the Paradise system is added into the game. Daily tasks will remain, but once the reputation milestones are reached, the tasks will disappear. Daily Una’s rewards will be moved to weekly quest rewards.
