title: Addressing Community Feedback and Anticipated Changes
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/35SzHNct6fghTK0PS3RvQu/6bb37039954b546deeadea234687d9f2/LA_Blog_SS_09_1920.jpg Heroes of Arkesia, Following the recent Korean Live Stream, we know many of you have questions about how these announcements will impact the Western version of the game. To ensure transparency and avoid speculation, we want to clarify what you can expect based on our internal discussions. Nerfs and Endgame Balance While Smilegate RPG has announced gold adjustments to various raid levels in the Korean version, our region's economy and gold income are not 1:1. We understand concerns about implementing certain nerfs at this stage. Doing so now could negatively impact the experience for both new and returning players, as well as endgame players who are still progressing. Since we are behind the Korean version in terms of how long these raids have been available, we want to carefully consider any gold balance changes to ensure they don’t disrupt progression or overall gameplay experience. We will continue to monitor this closely and provide updates as needed. However, to ease progression costs for new and returning players, we will be implementing the Transcendence and Advanced Honing nerfs. These changes will help make progression more accessible without the negative impact that gold nerfs might have caused. These will be reflected in the April update and are as follows: Advanced Honing Required shards and silver -20% for Tempering stage 1 and 2 Required honing materials -50% to progress Advanced honing level 1 - 20 Required Shards, Silver and Gold -20% for Advanced honing level 1 - 20 Armor Transcendence Restoration 740 Gold > 510 Gold Purification 110 Gold > 75 Gold Weapon Transcendence Restoration 2,200 Gold > 1,460 Gold Purification 190 Gold > 125 Gold Gem System Adjustments We recognize that the current gem system creates barriers to both character progression and playstyle flexibility. Our goal is to create an environment where players can freely enjoy their favorite classes without unnecessary restrictions. While some players choose to play multiple characters of the same class for fun, others choose to optimize gem usage, our focus is on promoting a healthy balance where players feel free to explore classes based on what they find most enjoyable. We will continue to evaluate ways to support greater class diversity and player choice. Smilegate RPG is actively exploring solutions to make the gem system more flexible. We are carefully evaluating multiple options, each with its own pros and cons, to find the best path forward. This process takes time, and we appreciate your patience as we work toward a balanced solution. We’ve said it many times before, but your feedback is invaluable to us. While we may not respond to every social post, we are always listening, actively discussing player concerns, and considering both data and community input in our decisions. Your passion and dedication help shape the game, and we encourage you to continue sharing your thoughts in constructive discussions. Class Balance Patch Class balance is vital to maintaining a fair and engaging gameplay experience, and we take it very seriously. We always strive to bring the latest class balance updates to the Western version as soon as possible. Smilegate RPG’s recent balance patch will be applied in the West’s April update, bringing several important class adjustments. We appreciate your patience as we finalize specifics for the Western version and will continue to share updates as they become available. Content Localization Updates As our game has evolved, we've significantly narrowed the gap with the Korean version. Initially, the well-defined two year roadmap allowed ample time for localizing new continents, raids, in-game guides, and other content across multiple languages. However, as we've got closer to the Korean updates, we've seen increased demand on localization. After careful analysis of player language preferences, we've discovered that German and French localizations are currently being utilized by a much smaller portion of our community than anticipated. Therefore, beginning with the May update, we will cease supporting German and French localizations and reallocate resources to the remaining languages to support the increased localization demand. The game will transition to English voice-over and text for players who previously selected German or French. Moving forward, we will be focusing our localization efforts on English and Spanish support. Our website will also reflect this change for a consistent experience across all platforms, with the in-game translations being supported on the site. You will see these changes take place throughout April. We continue to evaluate our localization strategy and appreciate your understanding as we work to deliver timely content updates. title: Team Update - Recent Ban Waves
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/1lRc0vqyB3SIciI5BmRM8w/4a8d2f148595e609683b54ff1d71b3a7/destroyer_characterart_1920x1080.jpg Heroes of Arkesia, We wanted to take a moment to discuss recent ban waves, publicly share some updated plans related to one of the core tenets of the Amazon Games Code of Conduct— Play Fair. Specifically, we want to discuss the ban waves, and provide a few policy reminders related to RMT and botting behavior. Anti-Cheat and Anti-bot Measures Do not cheat, bot, hack, or use other software or services that give you an unfair advantage through, for example, unattended gameplay or game modifications. Combatting bots has been an ongoing initiative of collaboration between our internal Anti-Cheat teams, Easy Anti-Cheat, and Smilegate RPG. We are constantly evolving detection methods and limiting the impact that bots can have on the economy and general player experience, along with the the use of illicit programs that allow players to automate daily activities and tasks within the game. After reviewing the ban waves, our team found that some accounts, which had no prior violations or bad behavior, used the program to automate daily tasks. While these accounts did not deserve a permanent ban, using the program still violates the Code of Conduct, and it warrants a serious infraction. As a result, these accounts will have their permanent bans reduced to a 30-day suspension. The days already spent banned will count toward this 30-day suspension. We hope that these players will embody the tenet of “Play Fair” heading forward, especially with the recent changes to reduce the load of dailies by speeding up activities and only requiring a single Kurzan Frontline/Chaos Dungeon per character each day. Any further infractions or violations will result in the permanent ban being reinstated. RMT Bans Do not engage in real-money trading of in-game items and in-game currencies. RMT Bans have and will, continue to rollout in an ongoing basis. We have seen a lot of community conversations discussing the bans, along with false narratives being publicly shared, so we wanted to provide a few reminders and clarifications. First off, RMT investigations are thoroughly vetted and manually looked into. Oftentimes, players are not willing to share the entire truth after engaging in behavior violating the Code of Conduct, which can lead to speculation and confusion in the community. Additionally, ban/suspension appeals are manually reviewed, not automatically declined. While there are response templates built to communicate a decision, they are not automatically sent out. These responses can be sent out quickly to communicate decisions after an appeal is reviewed, especially in cases where the evidence of illicit activities is concrete, or when the appeal provided was not relevant to the reason for the ban. If you ever in doubt of whether or not an action is allowed, please review the Amazon Games Code of Conduct or Terms of Service. Thank you for your continued support, and we’ll see you in Arkesia.

title: Wildsoul Design Process - Behind the Scenes
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/5iTTajdHWWMe8vKEi4q85e/c93e7a95d979b48cea39197e19307579/LA_Wildsoul_BTS_Art_Final_1920x1080_CT-000017156.jpg Heroes of Arkesia, We sat down with the Smilegate RPG development team to explore how they crafted the latest Lost Ark Advanced Class: Wildsoul. A mischievous shapeshifter with a deep connection to nature, Wildsoul blends illusion magic, animal transformations, and raw combat power into a fast-paced, strategic playstyle. From her dual-animal spirit magic to her playful yet powerful sound design, here’s how Wildsoul was brought to life. Q: Wildsoul is a really unique addition to the game. What makes her stand out? Dev Team: Most Yoz inherit a single animal spirit, which shapes their abilities and even their physical traits. Wildsoul? She’s an exception—a once-in-a-century phenomenon who possesses two spirits: the raw power of a bear and the cunning agility of a fox. This dual connection makes her incredibly powerful but also unstable, which is why she seals her abilities inside a mystical scroll. It’s the only way she can contain her magic—until she needs to unleash it in battle. That’s when things get really interesting. https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/MQb3yDCUmUfQta2SFnmx6/7d2563fecd02cea5b5d85196d1fd58aa/LA_Wildsoul_BTS_Art_Final_1920x1080_CT-000017156.jpg Q: Let’s talk about that magic—how does Wildsoul’s power actually work? Dev Team: She has two core abilities: illusion magic and shapeshifting. Illusion magic lets her summon spectral beasts—a massive bear charging through enemies, a fox darting between attacks, or a murder of crows creating pure chaos. These summons feel like living creatures, acting as an extension of her spirit. She doesn’t just summon animals—she becomes them. In bear form, she’s a force of nature, dealing heavy, ground-shaking attacks. In fox form, she’s lightning-fast, weaving through enemies and striking with deadly precision. What makes her fun to play is that she can seamlessly switch forms mid-battle, adapting to whatever the situation demands. One moment she’s evading, the next she’s overwhelming enemies with sheer strength. https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/4y6npbtykeOYW0cz9FXm8Z/27867f3af7c60f05f9a531226eb0e334/LA_Wildsoul_BTS_Art_Final_1920x1080_CT-000017156.jpg Q: Her design feels really distinct—what were the inspirations behind her look? Dev Team: From the start, we wanted Wildsoul to fully embody the spirit of the Yoz—a culture deeply connected to nature, illusion magic, and spiritual energy. Her look had to reflect that, but in a way that made her feel truly unique. We drew inspiration from a variety of cultural aesthetics and traditions, blending these elements to create a character with a rich and distinctive identity. Her clothing and accessories incorporate natural materials, layered fabrics, and intricate patterns, all designed to reflect her deep connection to the land. Since Rimeria, the homeland of the Yoz, is close to Anikka, we also wove in subtle Eastern influences to show the cultural exchange between these regions. The result is a character that feels like she truly belongs in the world, while still standing out as one of its rarest warriors. https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/4ypnbIb8pRIFCGOV2ZhqKw/fbc0754b64f8b4db36b21be56f13dad5/LA_Wildsoul_BTS_Art_Final_1920x1080_CT-000017156.jpg Q: Let’s talk about sound—what went into designing Wildsoul’s audio? Dev Team: We wanted her sound design to reflect her playful but powerful personality. She’s mischievous, a little unpredictable, but never to be underestimated. For example, in her “Ursine Windup” attack, she lets out a slight struggle sound as she swings her arm—because let’s be honest, swinging a giant bear claw isn’t easy! But when she lands the hit? Boom. The impact makes it clear—this is a character who hits hard. Her “Swish Bear” transformation starts with a soft, mystical hum, which then deepens into a low, resonant vibration once she fully shifts. Meanwhile, her fox form is all about quick, sharp sounds, emphasizing her agility. Even her animal cries—from the fox’s call to the crow’s caw—were carefully tuned to feel real but slightly magical. We wanted every sound to reinforce the idea that Wildsoul is skilled at illusion and a powerhouse, and we’re really happy with how it all came together. Q: Finally, why should players be excited to play Wildsoul? Dev Team: If you love fast-paced, strategic combat, Wildsoul is for you. She’s not a straightforward tank, nor is she a typical rogue—she’s a shapeshifter and an illusionist, all in one. It has been an exciting several weeks since the Wildsoul’s launch in Arkesia, with players leveling up and battle the Demon Legions in new ways with Wildsoul. Now’s the perfect time to take part in the ongoing progression events and make the most of her arrival. title: Class Spotlight: Wildsoul — Unleash the Wildsoul Within
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/4uDVFm941E8oWD4ThlXM9j/bd3aee119571455aba91afed349f8ed0/LA_Wildsoul_Transform_Final_1920x1080_CT-000000000.jpg The call of the wild is relentless, a force that cannot be ignored. Those who answer it become more than warriors; they become legends. Introducing the Wildsoul class, arriving in Arkesia on February 26th, a striking new addition that embodies the raw, unbridled energy of nature’s fiercest protectors. Whether you harness the spirit of the celestial or revel in the shadows of the unknown, this class is a testament to the balance of grace, power, and primal might. Players eager to unlock Wildsoul’s full potential can embark on a Class Awakening Quest, earning 15 new achievements, a new title, and a new trophy, along with a Training Room Guide to help refine their skills. But the Wildsoul class is more than just aesthetics. Wildsoul warriors channel their connection to nature through two distinct specializations: Transformation and Spirit Beast Summoning, offering an adaptable and exhilarating combat experience. CLASS PLAYSTYLE & IDENTITY Wild Soul is a Specialist Advanced Class that revolves around a unique three-meter identity system, enabling players to shift between Bear, Fox, and Phantom Beast Awakening forms. The class features two primary playstyles: Phantom Beast Awakening (Swiftness/Crit–Non-Transformation Focused) A fast-paced, high-tempo build that focuses on skill cycling and identity gauge management, allowing for near-constant uptime on powerful buffs. High mobility and low cooldowns, similar to Reflux Sorceress. Stacks Essence Buff while in the Phantom Beast Awakening form, then consumes stacks with the Identity Skill (Z) for: Cooldown Reduction (5% per stack). Mana Recovery (2% per stack). A high-speed combat loop Fill the identity gauge. Activate Phantom Beast Awakening Form. Cycle skills rapidly. Consume stacks for cooldown resets. Repeat. Wild Instincts (Specialization/Crit–Transformation-Based) A burst-focused playstyle that shifts between Bear and Fox forms, utilizing a powerful fourth skill mechanic for massive damage boosts. Bear Form: Tanks damage and gains damage reduction. Fox Form: Increases attack speed for faster skill execution. Every fourth skill cast within transformation receives a 40% damage boost. Gameplay loop: Alternate between Bear and Fox forms. Build identity. Use a fourth skill for burst. Temporarily exit transformation to regenerate the gauge. Repeat. CLASS CHARACTERISTICS Wild Soul strikes a balance between survivability and offensive versatility, offering: Class Synergy: Applies a 12% defense reduction debuff to enemies. Tanky Survivability: 2.1 HP coefficient and 100% defense scaling (similar to Slayer and Artillerist). Innate Critical Damage Scaling: Similar to Aeromancer, Wild Soul has baked-in critical damage bonuses. Flexible Skill System: Similar to Breaker, Wild Soul’s skills automatically shift forms based on activation. Skill Types: Green Skills: Exit transformation and regenerate identity gauge. Yellow Skills: Bear Form abilities. Blue Skills: Fox Form abilities. Unique Identity Gauge: Tracks three meters, dynamically shifting based on the active transformation. The Phantom Beast Awakening Form lasts 30 seconds, with a stackable Essence Buff mechanic. A Warrior in Harmony with Nature Wildsoul fighters are more than just skilled combatants; they are guardians of the natural order, channeling the essence of the wilderness into their every move. They strike with the precision of a predator and move with the fluidity of the wind, making them unpredictable foes and invaluable allies. Their connection to the land gives them heightened reflexes, the ability to adapt in battle, and an unmatched resilience that allows them to thrive in even the most chaotic encounters. Transformation Specialization: This path enables the Wildsoul to morph into powerful animal forms, such as a bear or fox, each offering unique abilities and combat styles. As the Wildsoul uses transformation skills, they accumulate specific meters corresponding to each form. Building up these meters allows the player to unleash potent finishing moves, delivering devastating damage to enemies. Additionally, maintaining transformation stacks provides various buffs, including passive healing, increased attack speed, and the application of armor break synergies, enhancing both personal and party performance in battle. Spirit Beast Summoning Specialization: In this build, the Wildsoul focuses on summoning ethereal spirit beasts to aid in combat. By utilizing spirit beast skills, players fill a unique meter that, once maxed, can be activated to enter an “Awakened” state. During this state, the Wildsoul experiences increased attack and movement speed, as well as a significant boost in critical damage. Landing spirit beast skills in this mode generates orbs that can be collected to restore mana and reset skill cooldowns, allowing for sustained offensive capab...

First, we’ll cover some details for the upcoming update, and then dive into policy adjustments built to make the party-finder tool a better experience. February Updates Wildsoul + Progression Events The latest class— Wildsoul— will arrive alongside progression events built to support it, including a South Kurzan Powerpass, the latest Mokoko Express event, and a third event in the works (spoiler alert, expect some help with Advanced Honing). We typically see a higher volume of returning players for new class releases and progression events, and want to ensure that they are not only supported by in-game systems, but also the broader Lost Ark community. Mokoko Bootcamp To help further teach these players the ropes, or brush up on rusty raiding skills, we are bringing back the Mokoko Bootcamp Event. Community feedback coming out of the event’s debut was extremely helpful, and something we will continue to look at coming out of the second iteration of the event. We are looking into longer-term solutions to make the event a permanent system in the game, but weren’t ready to roll out those changes in time for the Wildsoul release and progression events. This version of the Mokoko Bootcamp will include players who had not logged-in within the last 60 days, or created a new account within the last 60 days, and who are under Item Level 1670. For the more permanent solution, we will continue to evaluate what defines a Mokoko. This event will run for a few months, similar to the initial iteration (with some refreshed and updated rewards) as we continue to monitor in-game data and player feedback on our path to making it a more permanent system. Players will notice overhauls to the rewards, including a new special “Mokoko Legion Commander” title. We saw a lot of feedback on the volume of other available rewards, and will be juicing those up to ensure the event is worthwhile to all players. And, as we know you’re curious, while the event itself will not give away a Relic Engraving Selector, there will be one arriving for players elsewhere in the February update. We hope the special chase items along with increased honing and other progression materials will make it worthwhile for all. We’re looking forward to seeing how this event helps support new and returning players joining for the February update, and will be monitoring your feedback as we look to solidify the future of Mokoko Bootcamp. Party Finder Policy Adjustments & Reminders Given the context discussed around supporting returning players and coupled with the return of the Mokoko Bootcamp, we will no longer permit the promotion of bussing and other services from the in-game party-finder tool. Our goal is to foster a better party-finder experience for new or returning players where they can better find learning groups with each other, or find a veteran party willing to show a Mokoko the ropes in exchange for Mokoko Bootcamp event tokens. For the first two weeks (beginning tomorrow, February 18), players violating the new policy will receive a 15-minute suspension as a first time reminder and warning, with subsequent penalties beginning at 1 day, with escalating penalties (up to week-long and then month-long suspensions) for repeat offenses. After the two week period concludes, suspensions for violating the policy will begin at 1 day, and then follow the escalating penalties for repeat offenses. Spamming chat (such as Area Chat) with promotions will also incur the same penalty. Bussing in Lost Ark has always been an “at your own risk” activity. Gold, items, or materials accepted from other players may be attached to a bad faith history, and subject for removal. Players may receive penalties if they receive illicit items, as it can be hard to verify the intention for payments that included gold generated from bots or past RMT, and will need to appeal the decision with appropriate evidence. As a final note while we’re talking about making the Party Finder a more welcoming experience, we wanted to provide a reminder that offering piloting services is a serious offense and will incur corresponding penalties, including permanent bans.

title: Lost Ark 2025 Roadmap - Part 1
contents: https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/EejTfQIoRy87VLZFdt4G4/5d4f74100edde328f444f11a4107951e/EN_LA_Roadmap_Part_1_1920x1080.jpg Heroes of Arkesia, We’re excited to share a first look at December and the first few months of next year with the first part of the 2025 Roadmap! Join Lost Ark team members Henry and Roxx for a discussion of the key content arriving in December 2024 through March 2025. The roadmap content discussed are highlights we know players are eagerly awaiting, but the roadmap is not a comprehensive list of every change arriving in Arkesia over the next few months, and could change. As we approach each month, more details will be shared. Stay tuned to our website and social channels for future Release Notes, including the full list of new content, cosmetics, content balance changes, events, and more included in our major monthly updates. December 2024 https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/2RR8Tg4UPLYH9TAE0q8v38/653230bf9c996305cfcfb0e20f4a16c7/LA_Roadmap_DEC_1920x1080.jpg There are some big changes coming in December alongside their releases in Korea that we’re excited to reveal. The full release notes will arrive on December 17 with the full details and content arriving this month. The following list is a summary of key updates. Solo Mode Update Prepare to challenge notorious threats solo for the first time, with the Thaemine Legion Raid and Echidna Kazeros Raid added to the roster of raids available in Solo Mode. An update to Solo Mode will also be added, including a new buff system and cost reductions to the “View More Rewards”. Kazeros Raid: Act 2 Prologue The prologue quest covers the story of how the Allied Forces begins a new strategy to overcome the current situation for the ongoing war in North Kurzan. As you progress through the prologue quest, you will learn the new strategy of the Allied Forces and after fighting Aegir, as we head toward the battle against Narok and Brelshaza. Elixir & Transcendence Adjustments The Elixir progression system has been overhauled to make Elixir transmutation faster and less strategic to simplify the experience. The Transcendence system has been overhauled to simplify the progression path. Proving Grounds Season 6 Proving Ground Season 6 will begin in December. Prove you’re one of the best warriors in Arkesia to earn season ranks, rewards, and prestige in Season 6 of competitive Proving Grounds. Icy Breakthrough Event A new mission-based progression event arrives, built to help players progress through the beginning of Tier 4. It’s a great continuation of the ongoing Hyper Awakening Road Event, and will help with progression in early Tier 4. There are four categories of missions: Weapon Honing Armor Honing Clearing Echidna Gates Clearing Behemoth Gates The honing missions will grant Hellfire Honing Books and Gold as you hone your gear over Item Level 1640. The Echidna missions will grant Agris’ Scales, Alcaone’s Eye, and additional support materials, and the Behemoth missions will grant Behemoth’s Scales and Weapon Transcendence Restoration Tickets. January 2025 https://images.ctfassets.net/umhrp0op95v1/5NKbjIBvZ3rTNbJkfpc3f8/7a9ff158c84e0b79f263d4d2ebddfb81/LA_Roadmap_JAN_1920x1080.jpg Kazeros Raid Act 2: Requiem of the Floating Nightmare Face off against Brelshaza once more in Kazeros Raid Act 2: Requiem of the Floating Nightmare. This raid will require 8-players, and take place in a harsh, icy battleground, which provides the perfect backdrop for Brelshaza’s own chilling new powers. In Gate 1, the Valley of Piercing Screams, you’ll have to fight the intimidating Narok the Butcher, and in Gate 2, Phantom Apeiron, you’ll see the familiar Brelshaza with some new abilities. This raid will also introduce the Karma System, which will allow players to receive new ways to power up their characters. Normal Mode will be available at Item level 1670, and Hard Mode will be available at Item Level 1690. We will include the latest improvements to the raid applied in Korea, such as showing targeting effect during certain patterns in Gate 1. Along with Brelshaza, a host of new Tier 4 content will arrive, including the release of Tier 4 Bracelets, a new Guardian, Abidos Operation, a Chaos Gate for players over Item Level 1680, and the 2nd Unlock of the T4 Ebony Cube. Frontier System When the frontier system is applied, raid difficulty (damage and HP) will decrease for raid bosses as stage of the frontier progresses. The stages progress automatically as time goes on. With the frontier system, parties clearing cutting-edge content can enjoy a similar difficulty to Korea when the raid releases, and others can enjoy an easier version as time passes; making the raid more approachable for more casual players while also lessening the reclear difficulty. contents: Heroes of Arkesia, During weekly maintenance a new event will be added and Server Transfers will be enabled for Ignite players to move to Legacy Servers. Downtime will begin on October 30 at 12am PT (7am UTC) and is expected to last 5 hours. Learn about the new event and transfer experience below. Mokoko Bootcamp Event The Mokoko Bootcamp Event runs from October 30th to January 15th, 2025 and is designed to encourage veteran players to play dungeons with new or returning players. New and returning players whose highest Item Level character on their account is below Item Level 1660 can earn "Mokoko Tokens" for completing dungeons during the event period. These new and returning players will have a "green leaf" icon in the recruitment panel. Green leaf Mokoko players will be those who meet one of the following conditions: A new account that has been created within the event period Accounts that have been created within 60 days before the event start date Accounts with a previous Login Date over 60 days before the event start date Once a player acquires the “green leaf”, it will persist until the end of the event, but will expire when any of the characters in that player’s account is over Item Level 1660. Veteran players, defined as active players not belonging to the categories above, can earn "Expert Tokens" when they complete dungeons together with the new/returning players. Both the Mokoko Tokens and Expert Tokens can then be exchanged for rewards, with the number of Tokens earned varying based on which specific dungeons are completed. As long as there is at least one new/returning player in the group, the entire team qualifies to earn the respective Tokens. The reward tables will be slightly different for new players and returning players, but both reward tables will have both weekly and once-per-roster items. Both groups will have access to honing materials and even Metallurgy/Tailoring: Hellfire honing books to help hone in Tier 4. Mokoko Tokens will better help newer players get caught up on things like cards and other methods of progression. The Expert Tokens will grant endgame items, including a Relic Engraving Selection chest, and a “Mokoko General” title with a special icon title for helping new players out! Ignite Server Transfer The transfer window allowing Ignite players to transfer a single character to Legacy servers will open with the update, and will remain open until November 25. There are two types of transfers: Roster Transfer (better for new players) - move some roster level information to a server without an existing roster, along with the chosen character. Character Transfer (better for returning or active players) - merge your chosen Ignite character into an existing roster. To view what will (or will not) transfer with each type of transfer, visit our Ignite Servers Merge Policy Page. We’re excited to welcome new and returning Ignite players to Legacy Servers as reinforcements in the fight against Kazeros. New threats will be able to be challenged in the North Kurzan storyline, Behemoth Epic Raid, and the Echidna and Aegir Kazeros Raids. In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia!

title: Team Update: Addressing the Reward Exploit
contents: Heroes of Arkesia, A bug was identified with Ignite reward chests, which some players were able to repeatedly exploit. Our team has been investigating the extent of the issue, and wanted to communicate our decision on the penalty for those who abused the exploit. As a reminder, a key tenet of the Amazon Games Code of Conduct is to “Play Fair”. We reserve the right to determine what constitutes unfair play and to take corrective action we deem appropriate, and the abuse of this exploit will have corrective action taken, with suspensions and bans already sent out. General Policy Slightly over 2,300 players received rewards chests from the Ignite Stronghold reward issue. Within this group, over 1,200 did not open any of the reward chests. The group that did not open any reward chests will not have any action taken against their accounts apart from removing the unopened chests from their inventory. For the remaining 1,000 players who opened the reward chests, the severity of the penalty will directly correspond to the level of bug exploitation. At a base level, all items will be removed and skill tree levels will be rolled back. For items that were used and cannot be removed, players may have gold (or the gold value of the used items) deducted from their balance, or be sent into the negatives corresponding to the severity of the abuse. This policy will apply to all materials, including processed chaos stones and combined honing materials. Along with the item withdrawals, players will be receiving suspensions and bans matching their level of exploit. The first group are players who may have mistakenly encountered the issue and did not repeatedly abuse the bug. Players who opened 1 or 2 chests will have any items withdrawn and have not been suspended/banned at this time. Our team is investigating if we can remove the items for this group during maintenance. If the item removal process is gauged to take longer than the maintenance period, this group of players will receive a short suspension to give our team the time needed to remove the items. Spending these items in the meantime will result in further action, such as gold removal. Players who continually exploited the issue and opened multiple reward chests will have more severe action taken, corresponding to their level of exploit. Players that opened 3 - 7 chests will receive a two-week suspension. Players that opened 8 - 14 chests will receive a 1-month suspension. Players that opened 15+ chests will receive a notice that they have received a 30-day suspension and are pending further review. This group will have various levels of action taken, up to permanent bans from the game. Issue Resolution To stop exploitation of the main reward issue and other bugs, access to strongholds was disabled. For players who have a character stuck in a stronghold, and need access to that character immediately, please submit a customer support ticket. Otherwise, the issue will be resolved during maintenance for the October 23 update. We will also re-enable the use of the Ignite reward chests at this time for players on Ignite Servers. Based on our policies and investigation, we believe this is the best course of action. We know many players were concerned about the outcome, and we wanted to be clear with our approach. In the future, if you encounter an issue you believe is an exploit or unintended issue, do not engage with the issue (no matter how tempting it may seem) and report it to our teams. We appreciate those who reported the issue, along with your patience while members our team investigated and blocked access to certain in-game systems. While this issue gained high visibility in the community, we hope this policy is clear and allows us to move forward together. We are always open to community feedback, and welcome you to engage in the conversation on our official channels. There are still key moments coming to Arkesia this week, with Aegir’s arrival and Ignite Server transfers arriving. Those aren’t the only things arriving in the update— stay tuned for the full release notes on Tuesday. In the meantime, we’ll see you in Arkesia.
